name: Computer screen
description: Imagine this thought on a computer screen. Change the font, color, and format. Animate the words. Add in a bouncing ball.

name: Say it in a silly voice
Naming the story
description: If all these thoughts and feelings were put into a book or movie, titled 'the something something story,' what would you call it? Each time this story shows up, name it: 'Aha, there's the XYZ story again!'

name: Thank your mind for that thought
The struggle switch
description: Is the struggle switch on, off, or at the halfway point we call 'tolerating it'? If the switch was like a dial with a scale of 0 to 10, and 10 is full on struggle, and 0 no struggle at all, then right now, what level are you? Are you willing to see if we can bring it down a notch or two?

name: Compassionate hand
description: Lay a hand on the part of your body where you feel this most intensely. Imagine this is a healing hand—the hand of a loving nurse or parent or partner. Send some warmth into this area—not to get rid of the feeling, but to open up around it, make room for it, hold it gently.

name: Pain as your ally
description: Use this emotion to motivate, communicate, illuminate.

name: Allowing
description: See if you can allow this feeling to be there. You don't have to like it or want it—just allow it.

name: Emotion surfing
description: Surf your feelings and urges as is they are ocean waves.

name: The curious child
description: Notice where this feeling is in your body. Zoom in on it. Observe it as if you are a curious child who has never encountered anything like this. Where are the edges? Where does it start and stop? Is it moving or still? Is it at the surface or inside you? Hot or cold? Light or heavy?

name: Mindful naming
description: Label the feeling mindfully: I'm noticing anxiety, Here is sadness, I'm having a feeling of anger.

name: Normalizing
description: This feeling tells you that you're a normal human being who has a heart and who cares. This is what humans feel when there's a gap between what we want and what we've got.

name: Dropping anchor
description: Acknowledge the feeling, connect with your body, and engage with the world.

name: Notice X, Y, Z ... So there's a part of you that's noticing
1000 mile journey: what's your first step?
